# SKRange

**Class**

A definition of a range of floating-point values.

## Declaration

```swift
class SKRange
```

## Overview

You typically use a [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKRange] to clamp a value so that it is within the specified range.

## Creating a Range Object

- **init(value:variance:)**: Creates and initializes a new range object using a value and a maximum distance from that value.
- **withNoLimits()**: Creates and initializes a new range object that encompasses all possible values.
- **init(lowerLimit:)**: Creates and initializes a new range object that specifies only a minimum value.
- **init(upperLimit:)**: Creates and initializes a new range object that specifies only a maximum value.
- **init(constantValue:)**: Creates and initializes a new range object that specifies a constant value.
- **init(lowerLimit:upperLimit:)**: Initializes a new range object.

## Inspecting a Range Object’s Limits

- **lowerLimit**: The minimum possible value.
- **upperLimit**: The maximum possible value.

## Mathematical Tools

- **SKKeyframeSequence**: An object that performs interpolation between values specified at different times (keyframes).
- **SKRegion**: The definition of an arbitrary area.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
